title: Relates to the display of live races and special events on telephones
summary: Relates to the display of live races and special events on telephones.

S T A T E   O F   N E W   Y O R K
       ________________________________________________________________________

                                         3703

                              2011-2012 Regular Sessions

                                 I N  A S S E M B L Y

                                   January 26, 2011
                                      ___________

       Introduced  by M. of A. PRETLOW, REILLY, SPANO -- read once and referred
         to the Committee on Racing and Wagering

       AN ACT to amend the racing, pari-mutuel wagering and  breeding  law,  in
         relation to displaying live races and special events on telephones

         THE  PEOPLE OF THE STATE OF NEW YORK, REPRESENTED IN SENATE AND ASSEM-
       BLY, DO ENACT AS FOLLOWS:

    1    Section 1. Subdivisions 4-a and 5 of section 1012 of the racing, pari-
    2  mutuel wagering and breeding law, subdivision 4-a as amended by  chapter
    3  18  of  the  laws  of 2008 and subdivision 5 as amended by section 11 of
    4  part C of chapter 134 of the laws  of  2010,  are  amended  to  read  as
    5  follows:
    6    4-a.  For  the  purposes of this section, "telephone betting accounts"
    7  and "telephone wagering" shall mean and include all those  wagers  which
    8  utilize  any  wired or wireless communications device, including but not
    9  limited to wireline telephones, wireless telephones, and  the  internet,
   10  to  DISPLAY  LIVE RACES AND SPECIAL EVENTS AND transmit the placement of
   11  wagers on races and special events offered  by  any  regional  off-track
   12  betting corporation, and any harness, thoroughbred, quarter horse racing
   13  association or corporation licensed or franchised to conduct pari-mutuel
   14  racing in New York state.
   15    5.  The  provisions  of  this  section  shall  NOT  BE  SUBJECT TO THE
   16  PROVISIONS OF SECTION ONE THOUSAND THREE OF  THIS  ARTICLE,  HOWEVER  NO
   17  RACES  OR  SPECIAL EVENTS SHALL BE DISPLAYED WITHOUT THE EXPRESS CONSENT
   18  OF THE ORIGINATOR OF THE RACES OR SPECIAL EVENTS, AND THIS SECTION SHALL
   19  expire and be of no further force and effect after June  thirtieth,  two
   20  thousand eleven.
   21    S  2. This act shall take effect immediately, provided that the amend-
   22  ments to section 1012 of the racing, pari-mutuel wagering  and  breeding
   23  law  made  by  section  one of this act shall expire on the same date as
   24  such section expires.

        EXPLANATION--Matter in ITALICS (underscored) is new; matter in brackets
                             [ ] is old law to be omitted.
                                                                  LBD05800-01-1
